title: Nick Clegg is doing the same dirty work for Meta he did for the UK’s Tory party
content:
In what many saw as a surprise move, Meta has promoted former UK deputy prime minister Nick Clegg to its president of global affairs. According to Mark Zuckerberg, Meta’s founder and CEO, Clegg is now “a senior leader at the level of myself … who can lead and represent us for all of our policy issues globally”. What should we make of this? It is too optimistic to think that Meta’s culture of personal data mining and manipulation might finally be coming to an end? Meta, formerly known as Facebook, has long been criticized for its data privacy and policy…

This story continues at The Next Web
description: There would be seemingly little stopping Meta from violating people’s data for decades to come. So is Clegg going to stop this from happening?
